result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie Lee Chaney

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jessie Lee Chaney in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Jessie Lee Chaney.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Due to court congestion and the lateness of the hour, Court orders case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Pretrial Services Violation Report 
Court will address at next court date of 10-20-2022 or earlier if non-compliance continues
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Jessie Lee Chaney in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Jessie Lee Chaney.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status. Defense requests plea and sentencing. Defense also advises the Court this case has a global offer with Defendant's other case 22CM324. Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing. Case remains calendared in Br 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Court ordered no contact with BLJ, GDG.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision LEVEL 5.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jessie Lee Chaney in court with attorney Theodore D. Kafkas.  Defendant Jessie Lee Chaney in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jessie Lee Chaney appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case 22CM0324 pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.   
This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
